item.title: Peglin coming to PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, and Xbox One on May 1
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/peglin-coming-to-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-and-xbox-one-on-may-1

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Smartphone
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Currently available for Switch, PC, iOS, and Android.

Publisher BlitWorks Games and developer Red Nexus Games will release pachinko roguelike RPG Peglin for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One on May 1 for $19.99 / €19.99, the companies announced.

Peglin first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on April 25, 2022, and iOS and Android on April 25, 2023, followed by a full launch for Switch and PC on August 27, 2024, and iOS and Android on August 28, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via BlitWorks Games:

About

The dragons have been popping peglins and stealing all of your gold for as long as you can remember. Enough is enough. It’s time to venture through the woods, conquer the fortress, and delve into the heart of the dragon’s lair to take back what’s yours and teach those dragons a lesson.

Peglin is a pachinko roguelike. Fight enemies by collecting special orbs and popping pegs to deal damage. The enemies are tough, and if you’re defeated your run is over, but you’ve got powerful orbs with special effects and incredible relics that influence both your enemies and the physics you’ll use to defeat them.

Aim carefully to survive in this unique turn-based RPG!

Key Features

  • Collect and upgrade powerful orbs and relics to defeat the monsters and bosses that stand in your way.
  • Fight enemies with Pachinko-like gameplay – hit more pegs to do more damage. Use crit potions, refresh potions, and bombs wisely.
  • Explore a new map every time, with different orbs, enemies, and surprises along the way.

Watch a new trailer below.

PlayStation and Xbox Announce Trailer

item.title: Doloc Town launches in Early Access on May 8
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/doloc-town-launches-in-early-access-on-may-8

  • PC

A post-apocalyptic side-scrolling farming simulation game.

Doloc Town, a pixel art side-scrolling farming adventure game set in a post-apocalyptic world, will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on May 8, publisher Logoi Games and developer RedSaw Games Studio announced.

“The positive feedback from our demo has been incredible, and we’re excited to take the next step with Early Access,” said RedSaw Games Studio producer Yao Fan in a press release. “We can’t wait to build Doloc Town together with our community, and Early Access is just the beginning.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Logoi Games:

About

Blending a unique mix of Stardew Valley, Fallout, and Terraria, Doloc Town invites players to explore a beautifully broken world, rebuild civilization, and uncover its secrets—all while growing crops and making new friends along the way.

Key Features

  • A Cozy Adventure – Farm, craft, and automate in a post-apocalyptic world—where growing crops is just the beginning of your adventure. Uncover the land’s secrets as you explore two vast, perilous landscapes: Rivervalley and the Wetland. The Early Access version offers 20+ hours of main story content, plus plenty of side quests to keep you engaged.
  • Farmer’s Journey – Farming lies at the heart of life in Doloc Town. Begin with just a few planting pots, carefully nurturing your first crops. As your skills grow, so will your farm – expand your fields, develop advanced growing techniques, and build structures to support your growing operation. Complement your harvests by crafting useful tools, cooking hearty meals, and fishing in nearby waters. Through seasons of hard work, watch your small garden blossom into a thriving homestead.
  • Restoration and Rebuilding – Acid rains, heatwaves, and unpredictable weather patterns add an extra layer of challenge to your farming efforts. With both basic and advanced farming systems, you’ll craft tools, protect your crops, and grow your farm into something truly unique. The land is decaying—and the key to saving it lies hidden in the ruins of those who came before.
  • A World That Feels Like Home – The hand-drawn art of Doloc Town is as cozy as it is captivating, blending the pixel charm of Terraria and Stardew Valley with the gritty, post-apocalyptic world of Fallout. Every detail—from the quirky townsfolk to the abandoned ruins—is designed to pull you into this world and make you feel like you belong, even in a land of decay. The residents offer you more than just resources; they share their stories, offer side-quests, and help you piece together the mysteries of the world.
  • Explore The wild and Drone Companions – Dive into the wilderness to collect much needed resources and discover untold secrets of this forgotten lands. Equip your auxiliary drones and get ready to battle against mysterious creatures along the journey. Whether you enjoy intense bullet shooting or prefer more leisurely exploration, Doloc Town offers flexible combat styles with DIY customizations for your robot helpers.

Watch a new trailer below.

Early Access Release Date Trailer

item.title: FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time ‘Chef Life Trial’ gameplay
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/fantasy-life-i-the-girl-who-steals-time-chef-life-trial-gameplay

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

11 minutes of new footage, this time in Korean.

Publisher LEVEL-5 and developer LEVEL-5 Osaka Office have released an 11-minute gameplay video for social slow-life RPG FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time dubbed “Chef Life Trial.”

FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals Time is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on May 21. It will support English, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, Simplified Chinese, French, Italian, German, and Spanish language options. Digital pre-orders opened earlier today. Read more about the game here.

Watch the footage below.

Chef Life Trial Gameplay
